channel.title: [PI] Slayer task option after every level
channel.description:
When you have an easy slayer task (ask for an easier task) and you level up ANY skill and click "click here to continue" on the skill level up interface, ill will bring up the option.. [code]case 12: sendOption2("Yes I would like a slayer task.", "No I would not like a slayer task."); c.dialogueAction = 5;[/code] I cant seem to figure out what it is that is causing this...
EDIT: It only happens to players, not owners..

item.title: [PI] Slayer task option after every level
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“HcoJustin, post:9, topic:513296”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=631539.msg4275224#msg4275224 date=1364888842]

That’s a bad idea for a fix. Cause if you use 12 ever it’s going to send that dialogue. Plus, it’s considered a memory leak if you don’t fix it…

So he just has to remember not to use id 12 anymore… Switch fall-through is not considered a memory leak in any form. It’s just an unintended side effect from not closing each block.

the levelUp method will consistently call for this item that doesn’t exist for the players.
[/quote]
That is not a memory leak? It is not creating any objects that won’t be garbage collected later. It is just an unwanted side effect. Please show me where we are dealing with uncollected memory[/quote]
Meh whatever lol.
Still.
It’s bad practice.

Read full topic
item.source: [PI] Slayer task option after every level

item.title: [PI] Slayer task option after every level
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:8, topic:513296”][quote author=HcoJustin link=topic=631539.msg4275221#msg4275221 date=1364888758]

That’s a bad idea for a fix. Cause if you use 12 ever it’s going to send that dialogue. Plus, it’s considered a memory leak if you don’t fix it…

So he just has to remember not to use id 12 anymore… Switch fall-through is not considered a memory leak in any form. It’s just an unintended side effect from not closing each block.
[/quote]
the levelUp method will consistently call for this item that doesn’t exist for the players.[/quote]
That is not a memory leak? It is not creating any objects that won’t be garbage collected later. It is just an unwanted side effect. Please show me where we are dealing with uncollected memory

item.title: [PI] Slayer task option after every level
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

sk8rdude461:

That’s a bad idea for a fix. Cause if you use 12 ever it’s going to send that dialogue. Plus, it’s considered a memory leak if you don’t fix it…

So he just has to remember not to use id 12 anymore… Switch fall-through is not considered a memory leak in any form. It’s just an unintended side effect from not closing each block.

item.source: [PI] Slayer task option after every level

item.title: [PI] Slayer task option after every level
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“DerpaDerpy, post:5, topic:513296”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=631539.msg4274970#msg4274970 date=1364865281]

check your levelup method in PlayerAssistant.

Nothing… Oh and I forgot to mention, it only happens to players not owners…

So you need to look for playerRights == 0 (I assume it’s this because it doesn’t happen to owners) in player assistant.
It has to do with the levelUp method because that’s when the dialogue is being sent.
Also look for c.getPA().sendDialogues(12
[/quote]
I fixed it, I just changed the Ids of the dialogue options[/quote]
That’s a bad idea for a fix. Cause if you use 12 ever it’s going to send that dialogue. Plus, it’s considered a memory leak if you don’t fix it…

Read full topic
item.source: [PI] Slayer task option after every level

It has to do with the levelUp method because that’s when the dialogue is being sent.
Also look for c.getPA().sendDialogues(12[/quote]
I fixed it, I just changed the Ids of the dialogue options
